properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 27 at 11:49PM PST until January 28 at 5:06PM PST by NWS Portland OR
properties.description:
NW Oregon/SW Washington Coastal Rivers Bulletin

...The National Weather Service in Portland has issued a flood
warning for the following rivers in Washington...

Grays River near Rosburg affecting Wahkiakum County

River forecasts are based on observed and forecast rainfall and
temperatures, and they include current and planned reservoir
releases.

For the latest river stages and forecasts, visit
weather.gov/portland.

The next update for these locations will be issued by 7 AM Tuesday.

The National Weather Service in Portland has issued a

* Flood Warning for
The Grays River near Rosburg
* until Tuesday afternoon.
* At 11 PM Monday the stage was...10.9 feet / 6300 cfs.
* Flood stage is 12.0 feet and flood flow is 8200 cfs.
* Minor flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...This river is forecast to rise above flood stage around
2 AM Tuesday and is expected to crest around 12.5 ft, then subside
below flood stage during the afternoon.
* Impact...Above 12 feet, expect some flooding of roads along and near
the Grays River, including roadway approaches to the Altoona Bridge
over the Grays, and portions of Covered Bridge Road, Barr-Durrah
Road, and Loop Road near Rosburg and Hwy 4.
properties.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown. Don't drive into flooded areas.
Avoid walking near riverbanks during high water.
